scenario:
Wall Street's Q4 earnings season begins next week with notable names like JPMorgan Chase, Wells Fargo, Citigroup, BlackRock, Bank of America, Goldman Sachs, UnitedHealth, and Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing reporting their financial results. The following week sees high-profile names like Netflix, American Express, Johnson & Johnson, Procter & Gamble, GE Aerospace, American Airlines, United Airlines, and Verizon report earnings. Mega-cap tech companies including Microsoft, Alphabet, Tesla, Meta Platforms, Amazon, and Apple are scheduled to release their quarterly updates in the final week of January.

Analysts expect annualized profit growth of +11.9% and an increase of +4.6% in revenue growth. The sector is expected to report the largest annualized earnings growth rate of all eleven sectors, at +39.5%. The sector is forecast to come in second, with +20.7% year-over-year EPS growth. The sector is expected to report the third-highest annualized earnings growth rate, at +14%.

Earnings from the sector are expected to tumble -24.6% compared to last year, the worst drop of any sector by far. The sector is projected to report the second worst Y-o-Y earnings slump of all eleven sectors, with EPS set to decline -3.8% from a year earlier.

In terms of revenue expectations, analysts have also decreased their estimates during the quarter. The S&P 500 is expected to report annualized sales growth of +4.6%, compared to expectations for revenue growth of +5.2% at the end of September.

38 stocks are forecast to deliver growth of more than 25% in both earnings per share and revenue. Notable tech-related names include Astera Labs, Nvidia, Coinbase, Super Micro Computer, Reddit, Robinhood, Seagate, Western Digital, AppLovin, Trade Desk, DraftKings, CrowdStrike, Cloudflare, Snowflake, and Palantir. Other stocks to watch include Eli Lilly, Newmont, Jeffries Financial, Blackstone, Prudential Financial, Affirm, Axon Enterprise, Comfort Systems, Toast, and On Holding.
